data.title: #soon! Part Un - The 60s-00s Girl Band Debut Breakthrough Rate
data.meta_description: Welcome to my very first rate y’all! This has been a long long time in the making, heck I waited over a year in that rate queue to bring you this list of...
data.text:
Welcome to my very first rate y’all! This has been a long long time in the making, heck I waited over a year in that rate queue to bring you this list of forgotten classics and yesteryear bops!

This rate looks at Girl Band Débuts over the 1960s (sixties) up to the 2000s (noughties) period. The list was shortlisted with some of the more prominent girl bands of each decade (we will look at the influences the sounds have had on other artists and development of what we now have as a modern girl band as this all comes together).

The criteria myself and the wonderful @londonrain looked at to bring you this list include selecting the act’s ‘breakthrough’ hit (so as to give everyone a level playing field if you will, since some broke with a huge hit right away while others struggled a little before getting going!), we thought breakthrough would be the band’s first top 20 in one of these three significant markets – United States, United Kingdom and/or Australia.

With the moving politics and societal changes of these decades, many themes will come up in this list as we journey through these wonderful songs so please find the list below to score and comment on!

List by decade (please use bolded links for better quality audio):

'60s

The Shirelles – Will You Love Me Tomorrow

The Crystals - There's No Other (Like My Baby)

The Angels - Til

The Marvelettes - Please Mr Postman

Patti Labelle & The Blue Belles - I Sold My Heart To the Junkman

The Exciters – Tell Him / Alternate Link

The Supremes - When The Lovelight Starts Shining Through His Eyes

The Ronettes - Be My Baby / Alternate Link

The Chiffons - He's So Fine

Martha & The Vandellas - Heatwave / Alternate Link

The Dixie Cups - Chapel of Love

The Shangri-Las - Remember (Walking In The Sand)

'70s

Love Unlimited – Walkin’ In The Rain With The One I Love

The Three Degrees – When Will I See You Again

Honey Cone - Want Ads / Alternate Link

The Pointer Sisters - Yes We Can Can / Alternate Link

First Choice - Armed and Extremely Dangerous / Alternate Link

Sister Sledge - Mama Never Told Me

Silver Convention - Fly, Robin, Fly / Alternate Link

High Inergy - You Can't Turn Me Off (In The Middle Of Turning Me On)

Peaches - Substitute

The Nolans – I’m In The Mood For Dancing

Baccara - Yes Sir, I Can Boogie

The Emotions – Best Of My Love / Alternate Link

'80s

The Go-Go's - Our Lips Are Sealed

Bananarama - It Ain't What You Do

Mary Jane Girls – All Night Long

Klymaxx - I Miss You

The Bangles - Manic Monday / Alternate Link

Pepsi & Shirlie - Heartache

Mel and Kim - Showing Out (Get Fresh At The Weekend)

Salt-N-Pepa - Push It

Exposé - Come Go With Me

Shakespears Sister - You're History / Alternate Link

Sweet Sensation - Sincerely Yours

The Cover Girls – We Can’t Go Wrong

'90s

Wilson Phillips - Hold On

En Vogue - Hold On

TLC - Ain't 2 Proud 2 Beg

SWV - I'm So Into You

Eternal - Stay

Spice Girls - Wannabe

All Saints - I Know Where It's At

Destiny’s Child - No, No, No Part 2

Honeyz - Finally Found

B*Witched - C'est La Vie

Atomic Kitten - Right Now

Xscape – Just Kickin’ It

'00s

Dixie Chicks – Goodbye Earl

Sugababes - Overload

Bardot - Poison

Mis-Teeq - Why?

Girls Aloud - Sound of the Underground / Alternate Link

Las Ketchup - The Ketchup Song

t.A.T.u. - All The Things She Said

The Pussycat Dolls - Don't Cha

The Veronicas - 4ever

Booty Luv - Boogie 2nite

Danity Kane – Show Stopper

The Saturdays - If This Is Love / Alternate Link

Spotify list, provided by the wonderful @londonrain!

The rules:

- You should all be well versed in the voting rules by now but if not - score each song out of 10 and give one 11 only, and that to your prized winner; or the song you think may need your help to go all the way!

- Scoring-wise – I will accept all scores up to 10 including one decimal point behind them (ie I’ll take 9.5, 9.6, 9.7, 9.8 but not 9.25 or 9.75)

- Comments are not compulsory but as you are aware from my participation in previous rates, I really appreciate them, and expect at least something for your 11 and your notable favourites or least favourites!

- Troll votes will be discarded or asked to be altered so please don’t try it, especially as it takes away enjoyment from other participants.

- Voting closes 28 days from today on March 13 @8pm (ish) AEST Time
